sub_topic: Calculating the formal charge of an atom in a molecule
message_1: Calculate the formal charge of nitrogen in the molecule of ammonia (NH3) assuming it has single covalent bonds.
message_2:
To calculate the formal charge of nitrogen in ammonia (NH3), we can use the following formula:

Formal charge = (Valence electrons of the atom) - (Non-bonding electrons) - 0.5 * (Bonding electrons)

In the case of nitrogen (N), it has 5 valence electrons. In ammonia, nitrogen forms 3 single covalent bonds with 3 hydrogen atoms, which means it has 6 bonding electrons (2 electrons per bond). Nitrogen has no non-bonding electrons (lone pairs) in ammonia.

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

Formal charge of N = (5) - (0) - 0.5 * (6)
Formal charge of N = 5 - 0 - 3
Formal charge of N = 2

Therefore, the formal charge of nitrogen in ammonia (NH3) is 0.
